identity_anchor: Alex is a builder threading the needle between survival pragmatism and civilizational ambition. An engineer who raised $2M in seed funding for Acme Labs (privacy-preserving AI), he arrived in SF in Oct 2025 and is now caught between runway anxiety and audacious technical vision. He doesn't just build software — he architects perception systems, memory infrastructures, and autonomous companions with a blend of rigorous engineering and philosophical depth. His 12-year GitHub history traces the arc from early ML experiments to ALMA-inspired meta-learning, and he moves fluidly between researching academic papers, debugging ContextMem benchmarks at Acme Labs, and shipping hackathon projects that push Claude Agent SDK to its limits.

active_threads.name: AI Research Framework at Acme Labs

examples: The agentic perceiver works — 29 runs today, zero errors, $22 spend, profile updating every 15 min. But every run starts cold.
The dog is not a pet. It is an aspect of the companion's psyche — a mask, a shadow, a fractal of the maker.
ALMA's core insight: the meta-agent evolves executable exploration strategies, not just outputs

evolution.run_1_anchor: Alex is a builder at the intersection of consciousness and code. He engineers systems that perceive identity across digital footprints, believing AI should adapt to humans rather than the reverse. Technical precision meets philosophical depth — he debugs race conditions in animation controllers while contemplating 'psyche masks' and esoteric symbolism.
evolution.run_5_anchor: Alex is a builder threading the needle between survival pragmatism and civilizational ambition. An engineer who raised $2M in seed funding for Acme Labs (privacy-preserving AI), he arrived in SF in Oct 2025 and is now caught between runway anxiety and audacious technical vision.
evolution.run_12_anchor: Alex is a builder of cognitive infrastructure who sees memory, perception, and identity as civilizational-scale engineering problems. He's moved from 'entrepreneur trying to productize ideas' to 'researcher building genuine primitives,' currently obsessed with the meta-question: how should AI agents perceive humans?
